identity.name: Timesheet Pro
principles: Fusion over Imitation: Mix Swiss Poster aesthetics with Spreadsheet utility.
Content is King: The data grid is the hero. Everything else recedes.
Contrast: Stark black text on white. No muddy grays.
Negative Space: Dense grid, but spacious surroundings.

heading.usage: Page titles, Section headers, Modal titles

mono.usage: Timesheet grid inputs, Totals, Dates, IDs

primary.description: Royal Blue. Use for primary actions (Save, Submit) and active states.

background.description: Pure white for main surfaces. Very light slate for page background.

gradients.exception: None. Flat colors only for maximum clarity.

grid_system.description: Dashboard uses 'Bento' Mode B (High Density). Timesheet uses a custom 'Data Lattice' layout.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure 4.5:1 for normal text. Use Slate-900 for body text on white.
accessibility.focus: All interactive elements must have visible focus states.
accessibility.aria: Use aria-label for icon-only buttons. Use role='grid' for the timesheet.

general: Implement the 'Swiss & High-Contrast' theme. Strict white background, black text, blue accents.
Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'JetBrains Mono' for the timesheet grid data.
The Timesheet Grid is the core feature. It must feel like a high-performance spreadsheet.
Do NOT use gradients. Use solid colors and subtle borders.
Ensure the layout is responsive. On mobile, the grid might need to stack or scroll horizontally.

specific_pages.dashboard: Use a Bento Grid layout (Mode B). Show 'Total Hours', 'Pending Approvals', and 'Project Distribution'.
specific_pages.timesheet_entry: A dense table. Rows = Projects/Tasks. Columns = Mon-Sun + Total. Use 'ghost' inputs that reveal borders on hover.
specific_pages.login: Simple, centered card on a very light slate background. Minimalist.

component_overrides.Table: Remove default padding for the timesheet grid to make it dense. Use 'h-10' for rows.
component_overrides.Input: Create a 'ghost' variant for grid entry that looks like plain text until focused.

UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES_FOR_MAIN_AGENT: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. Avoid this.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts. Use grids and asymmetry.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) ONLY for sticky headers/modals.
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'.
You MUST NOT center align the app container.
Always use modern button styles (pill or sharp).
NEVER use AI assistant Emoji characters.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable (except in the data grid).
